[Relic of Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relic of Progenitus)  
[Runed Stalactite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Runed Stalactite)  
  
He might be pretty underwhelming at first glance, but he's a huge combo enabler, allowing for reuse of creatures, repeat draw, burn, removal, bounce, etc. And all of this is very much possible with the use of a handful of commons. From a drafting standpoint, this guy turns a pile of commons into a pile of gems. A reusable spellbomb/capsule is the BEST kind of spellbomb/capsule.  
  
Not to mention he's a solid b... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I'm going to make this quick and easy to understand.  
  
This set was made for Drafting or Limited.  
  
If you draft this and any of the other low-cost common/uncommon artifacts ([Pyrite Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrite Spellbomb) and [Executioner's Capsule](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Executioner's Capsule) particularly), you'd have a continuous means of destroying creatures and/or dealing damage. In limited, that is beyond amazing. Your opponent has to somehow exile the artifact and also kill the Salvager.   
  
If this was uncommon, drafts would become one-sided. Even though drafting some huge rare is also one-sided, you can usually only get 1 of that card. I've seen people (myself included) drafting 3-4 of the same uncommons. That's just amazing.
posts.html:
I'm going to make this quick and easy to understand.

This set was made for Drafting or Limited.

If you draft this and any of the other low-cost common/uncommon artifacts (Pyrite Spellbomb and Executioner's Capsule particularly), you'd have a continuous means of destroying creatures and/or dealing damage. In limited, that is beyond amazing. Your opponent has to somehow exile the artifact and also kill the Salvager.

If this was uncommon, drafts would become one-sided. Even though drafting some huge rare is also one-sided, you can usually only get 1 of that card. I've seen people (myself included) drafting 3-4 of the same uncommons. That's just amazing.

posts.post_content:
Wait, are you all for real?   
  
I am skeptical about it's casting cost, but I am sure WOTC carefully drafted the Set. And carefully weighed other conditions, like 'what message does this send about future Core Sets?'  
  
This guy IS a kind of jank Rare, BUT, I think considering that his activation cost is very low, and has a lot of potential, it is maybe what [Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic) should have been.  
  
If you lower his CMC by 1 or 2, but keep all his stats the exact same, how much does that change your opinion?   
  
OBVIOUSLY lowering CMC is going to make every card better, but Some things that show up in Rules Text boxes -can't- be allowed unedited or without rarity shifts or whatever. This guy's rules text box is actually very attractive, which is not something every card can say. Some cards, lowering mana cost or raising mana cost doesn't do enough to fix their brokenness or enough to make them good.   
  
MM isn't just for Spike, people.   
  
MM is supposed to be, like, practically ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

3.5/5

posts.post_content:
Hmm... it's possible he did some nasty stuff back in the day, or could've done had Affinity not gone nuts. I can see him doing terrible, terrible things with the right artifacts, so let's just think on that. For example, [Ratchet Bomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ratchet Bomb)? Any of the ten spellbombs?  
  
And artifact creatures... oh. I get it. He turns [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) and [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter) into Reassembling Skeleton and his flying buddy. Huh...  
  
  
He's actually quite powerful. I wonder what his current price is...
